column1: What does the command "sudo apt update && sudo apt upgrade -y" do?
column2: This command updates and upgrades the packages in Ubuntu.

column1: What does the command "echo "options snd-hda-intel model=dell-headset-multi" | sudo tee -a /etc/modprobe.d/alsa-base.conf" do?
column2: This command enables headset mic input.

column1: What does the command "gsettings set org.gnome.mutter experimental-features "['scale-monitor-framebuffer']"" do?
column2: This command enables improved fractional scaling support for Ubuntu's GNOME environment using Wayland.

column1: What does the command "sudo sed -i 's/^GRUB_CMDLINE_LINUX_DEFAULT.*/GRUB_CMDLINE_LINUX_DEFAULT="quiet splash module_blacklist=hid_sensor_hub nvme.noacpi=1"/g' /etc/default/grub && sudo update-grub" do?
column2: This command disables the ALS sensor and adds an ACPI parameter to help ensure compatibility by disabling ACPI support for NVMe. It also updates the grub.

column1: What does the command "echo "[connection]" | sudo tee /etc/NetworkManager/conf.d/default-wifi-powersave-on.conf && echo "wifi.powersave = 2" | sudo tee -a /etc/NetworkManager/conf.d/default-wifi-powersave-on.conf" do?
column2: This command prevents wifi drop offs by changing the powersave from 3 to 2.
